member.summary: Represents a heap-based, array-backed output sink into which data can be written.

member.summary: Creates an instance of an , in which data can be written to, with the default initial capacity.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of an , in which data can be written to, with an initial capacity specified.
member.param: The minimum capacity with which to initialize the underlying buffer.
member.exception: Thrown when is not positive (i.e. less than or equal to 0).

member.name: P:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.WrittenMemory
member.summary: Returns the data written to the underlying buffer so far, as a .

member.name: P:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.WrittenSpan
member.summary: Returns the data written to the underlying buffer so far, as a .

member.name: P:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.WrittenCount
member.summary: Returns the amount of data written to the underlying buffer so far.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Capacity
member.summary: Returns the total amount of space within the underlying buffer.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.FreeCapacity
member.summary: Returns the amount of space available that can still be written into without forcing the underlying buffer to grow.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the data written to the underlying buffer.

remarks.para: You must reset or clear the before trying to re-use it.
The method is faster since it only sets to zero the writer's index while the method additionally zeroes the content of the underlying buffer.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.ResetWrittenCount
member.summary: Resets the data written to the underlying buffer without zeroing its content.

remarks.para: You must reset or clear the before trying to re-use it.
If you reset the writer using the method, the underlying buffer will not be cleared.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.Advance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notifies that amount of data was written to the output /
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to advance past the end of the underlying buffer.
member.remarks: You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.GetMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a to write to that is at least the requested length (specified by ). If no is provided (or it's equal to 0), some non-empty buffer is returned.

remarks.para: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.
If you reset the writer using the method, this method may return a non-cleared .
If you clear the writer using the method, this method will return a with its content zeroed.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.ArrayBufferWriter`1.GetSpan(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a to write to that is at least the requested length (specified by ). If no is provided (or it's equal to 0), some non-empty buffer is returned.

remarks.para: This will never return an empty .
There is no guarantee that successive calls will return the same buffer or the same-sized buffer.
You must request a new buffer after calling Advance to continue writing more data and cannot write to a previously acquired buffer.
If you reset the writer using the method, this method may return a non-cleared .
If you clear the writer using the method, this method will return a with its content zeroed.

member.summary: Returns the current contents as an and sets the collection to a zero length array.

member.name: M:System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArrayExtensions.BinarySearchBy``2(System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{``0},``1,System.Func{``0,``1,System.Int32})
member.summary: Executes a binary search over an array, but allows the caller to decide what constitutes a match
member.typeparam: Type of the elements in the array
Type of the argument to pass to the comparer
member.param: The array to search
An argument to pass to the comparison function

A comparison function that evaluates an item in the array. Return 0 if the item is a match, or -1 if the item indicates a successful match will be found in the left branch, or 1 if the item indicates a successful match will be found in the right branch.
member.returns: The index of the element found

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.

member.summary: Gets a mutable reference to a stored in a using variable.

remarks.para: This supporting method allows , a non-copyable implementing , to be used with using statements while still allowing them to be passed by reference in calls. The following two calls are equivalent:
âš Do not move or rename this method without updating the corresponding Razor.Diagnostics.Analyzers\PooledArrayBuilderAsRefAnalyzer.cs.

member.typeparam: The type of element stored in the pooled array builder.
member.param: A read-only reference to a pooled array builder which is part of a using statement.
member.returns: A mutable reference to the pooled array builder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.PooledObjects.PooledArrayBuilder`1
member.summary:
Wraps a pooled but doesn't allocate it until it's needed. Note: Dispose this to ensure that the pooled array builder is returned to the pool.
There is significant effort to avoid retrieving the . For very small arrays of length 4 or less, the elements will be stored on the stack. If the array grows larger than 4 elements, a builder will be employed. Afterward, the build will continue to be used, even if the arrays shrinks and has fewer than 4 elements.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.PooledObjects.PooledArrayBuilder`1.InlineCapacity
member.summary: The number of items that can be stored inline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.PooledObjects.PooledArrayBuilder`1._builder
member.summary: A builder to be used as storage after the first time that the number of items exceeds . Once the builder is used, it is still used even if the number of items shrinks below . Essentially, if this field is non-null, it will be used as storage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.PooledObjects.PooledArrayBuilder`1._capacity
